Text.Value: Now, bugger off and let me do my damn job.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: Bugger. Off.
Fully booked. And no, I don't care if your loved one was drowned, strangled, or butchered - I'm not making you a coffin.

EditorData.NodeContext: gruff, has had this same confo many times - apathetic

Text.Value: Fine. They can pick it up at sunset. Now, bugger off before I change my mind.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: I already said I'd make the kid's coffin. Bugger off, will you?

EditorData.NodeContext: a little gruff, annoyed at the interruption, not the player

Text.Value: Now, you want to bump someone else to the back of the queue? Fine - but it'll cost you. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

EditorData.NodeContext: apathetic - he doesn't care, he just wants to get paid

Text.Value: Then you'll have to wait like everybody else.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed - the player wasted his time for nothing

Text.Value: Congratulations, you've just guaranteed that I'm making you and the weepy duo nothing. Get out of my sight.

EditorData.NodeContext: furious

Text.Value: I don't have that kind of gold.
But it'll cost you. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

EditorData.NodeContext: apathetic - he doesn't care, he just wants to get paid

Text.Value: Leave.
Done. It'll be ready in a couple of hours. Now, clear off.

EditorData.NodeContext: business like, no nonsense

Text.Value: Please - only the simplest coffin is needed to ease the parents' suffering.
Compassion doesn't make coffins. That said, I could bump someone else to the back of the queue.

EditorData.NodeContext: apathetic, shrug - he just wants to get paid

Text.Value: Not even for a child? That couple is really upset.
I have lost a kid. And I gave him the best send-off I could.

EditorData.NodeContext: looking away, lost in the memory - the most sincere we see him. Emotional.

Text.Value: This is for a kid - please. How would you feel if you lost a child?
Bloody hells, fine. Tell them they can pick it up at sunset. Now, get out of my sight.

EditorData.NodeContext: rallies himself after an unexpected show of emotion. A little gruff but not mean at all

Text.Value: Then you'll be a long time standing.

EditorData.NodeContext: apathetic shrug

Text.Value: Hmm.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: Really? A man can't even work in peace now without being threatened, is it?

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: I'd make the damn thing myself - not bother good, hard-working people who are barely making ends meet.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: Morality don't pay the bills.

EditorData.NodeContext: annoyed

Text.Value: Sorry for bothering you.
This is for a child - an innocent soul. Make a coffin - it's the right thing to do.
Look, mate. Them getting the right coffin won't ease shit. Trust me.

EditorData.NodeContext: levelling with the player - he knows this won't help them, it didn't help him when he lost his kid

Text.Value: I'm not leaving without a coffin.
The city is chock-a-block with bodies thanks to these murders. I can barely keep up with all the orders.
You can either make those parents a coffin or I'll bury you alive.
Why? 'Cause they have a dead kid? Welcome to half the city.

EditorData.NodeContext: acts gruff, apathetic shrug, but he's saying this because he ALSO lost a kid

Text.Value: 'Spose I've still got the smaller coffin designs from when... Ahem.

EditorData.NodeContext: remembering the coffin he designed for his own child, gets choked up at ahem

Text.Value: Have some compassion.
How about I show you a more traditional burial? Though your skin might not like the flames.
Do you mind? These coffins won't make them damn selves.
Here - this should cover it. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Synopsis: An overworked coffin maker. He's gruff and unfriendly. In this dialogue, if you've spoken to the bereaved couple, you can try to convince him to make a coffin for a child.
